title: About Me
text:
üëã Hi, I‚Äôm Jitvan Vij
I‚Äôm a graduate student at Boston University, specializing in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, and Simulation Modeling.
With hands-on experience in Python, R, Spark, and AWS, I work at the intersection of data and decision-making. My background includes working on real-world projects in data mining, cloud-based data engineering, and Monte Carlo simulations.
When I‚Äôm not building models, I enjoy exploring productivity tools and deep diving into basketball analytics.

title: Projects
text:
Analyzed Chicago building violations using Python (Pandas, Matplotlib). Built custom features, visualized fine trends, and filtered disposition types to reveal insights in enforcement delays.



Simulated uniform distributions and order statistics to demonstrate CLT and probability curves. Modeled profit risk for boat production and optimized investment portfolios using Monte Carlo simulations.



Built relational tables from job postings data on Spark. Wrote SQL queries to uncover job trends, salary distribution, and industry breakdowns. Hosted all on EC2 instance.



Applied the Triple Catalyst model to Nike‚Äôs market/innovation/sustainability strategy. Also led stakeholder communication planning for a smart parking app (PiSA) using RACI & Power-Interest matrices.



Project management case study analyzing Flint‚Äôs communication breakdown, risk failures, and lack of oversight. Proposed policy-based solutions with a weighted scoring model.
